Comment 1: 
Assuming I'm reading the docs and source correctly, the behavior on windows is
equivalent to os.WSTOPPED being the (unchangeable) default - WaitForSingleProcess will
return upon the windows equivalent of SIGSTOP. The linux and plan9 behavior does
currently not match this, but probably should, for portability if no other reason. (On
the other hand, I don't even know if this behavior is possible from plan9.)

I've submitted a patch for linux: http://golang.org/cl/5700045
